column1: Like any other part of your body
column2: the spinal cord can be injured. Some people damage their spinal cords when they dive into a swimming pool that is too shallow for diving
column3: or even in a traffic accident. When the spinal cord is damaged
column4: the messages from the brain cannot travel to the rest of the body. Therefore
column6: the brain may no longer be able to send messages to the legs and the affected person may lose his ability to walk. A higher injury
column7: where the spinal cord is damaged closer to the neck (in the cervical level)
column8: may cause even more severe problems and some people are left unable to move their arms. Worst of all
column9: the cells in the spinal cord are very sensitive
column10: and this damage is often permanent
column11: meaning it cannot be fixed.In the United States of America
column12: it is estimated that there are about 906 people living with a spinal cord injury for every million people in the country. More than half of these spinal cord injuries are at the cervical level
column13: and most people who get these injuries are aged between 15 and 30 when it happens.
